column2: jenylen, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I am allergic to codiene, vicodin, motrin so my dr. prescribed Darvocet 500 mg. and it worked for my pain.  I have fibromyalgia and I only used it when I couldn't tolerate my pain any more.  I had no side effects.  If I had known they were going to take this drug off the market I would have asked for a renewal.  I don't believe the reasons or the organization/or drs. that took this drug off the market.  I found it to be a safe drug if you take it accordingly and not abuse it.  One pill worked for me, very seldom did I have to take 2.  I really wish Darvocet would come back to the pharmacies. I don't have pain medication right now since I'm allergic to many pain medica-tions that are out right now.

column2: eyes2die51@yahoo.com, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: i am allergic to all pain meds, demarol, morphine codeine darvocet was the only thing i could take for pain if you dont over use it it is a great med

column2: B., 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: This is an old drug an most people that have chronic back pain real do depend on it. I have strong meds but their are not for long time use.  I've use this drug for more than 20 years and have not ill effects from it!

column2: DEEDEE, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have had chronic pain for years Neck and upper back bulgling discs, I have been taking a combo of darvocet and Soma,My Dr has directed me to take these together at the same time. The Soma is a muscle relaxer the other of course is for pain relief. I drive about 4000 miles per month for my job and I have no issues with taking this medication I use this combo aprox 5x per day when I can tell I am not going to have relief I do have some 5mg of oxy to call things down again, I find that when my pain gets out of hand it effects my sleep at night when I cant get comfortable enough to sleep. Ask your DR if this combo will work for you I have been thru pain managent and thought I was gonna die they put me on morphine tabs that made me so ill from there we tried the fentyl patch that was another one that I felt as if I was floating out of my body,yikES!!

column2: Beverly120165, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Suffer from migraines and overall bad back. Muscle spasms and back pain are pretty much constant(car accident in 1976). Hate to take anything stronger than tylenol but gave it a shot this weekend when i almost could not move. Worked like a charm with almost no side effects(just a little sleepy). Would highly recommend

column2: phantom two, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: had shoulder surgery and took a drug containing codine that made me really sick. This drug has no side affect and works, but you need to use it every four hours or pain returns and it takes awhile to cut the pain again.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
doug, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I've found Darvocet to have the least negative issues as compared to vicodin or percocet. I'm still able to function (drive a car and even fly an airplane- OK, with a safety pilot) and have never been aware of it making me "goofy". I only take occasionally, so do not have issues with constipation or headaches as with the more powerful drugs). Back surgery dictated a need for pain relievers,probably forever- so Darvocet (occassionally) has never been an issue. Highly recommend it.  Just remember that it will probably be a step down in power from some of the others.

column9: I have been on Darvocet for a while now, NO CONSTIPATION!  Those of you who have this problem start taking a couple tablespoons of ground Flaxseed, with breakfast and drink a few glasses of water a day! It will help greatly.

column2: katherine, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Switched to Darvocet from Vicodin due to extreme nausea. However, with no prior episodes, almost immediately had serious mental side effects and discontinued use. Returned to half doses of vicodin with acceptable results. Would not recommend use of this drug. FDA recommended pulling this in 01/09.

column2: linda50, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: this med works great for most of my pain problems as long as i use the white not the pink generic pills. i'm not sure why but other people have told me the same thing including a pharmacy worker. up till recently i had no probs until i started taking b 12 vitamins 1500(mgs). now i have headaches all the time and feel lighted headed sometimes. does anyone know what is happening to me?

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: With temporary pins in a joint, I've been on this med for over a month now.  It dulls everything, and I sometimes feel high.  I would not even consider driving on this.  I have to drink a lot of water to be able to have a movement once every 3 days or so.  When I do have one, they are the size of dragons.  I no longer sleep well, just mostly drift in and out.  For the last week I've had a nasty ringing in my ears.  It's very annoying.  If I miss a dose, I have a nasty headache.  When this is over, I will request a different med next time.

column9: It has really helped my back pain.

column9: I have chronic Pancreatitis and back pain from being in a vehicular accident so this is a lifesaving drug for me.  Since I am allergic to most of the other painkillers my doctor suggested this for my daily use.

column9: I have recently been prescribed this medication for pain related to a fractured ankle. This medication does not help relieve any of the pain but instead just makes me feel tired. column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have migraines and Fibromyalgia. I use to take Vicoden and it was very helpful but I started to get very sick and dizzy before the medicine started to work! So my Dr. switched me to Darvocet and it helps (not as well as the vicoden) but I don't get any nausea or dizziness. The only bad thing I've found is I have terrible constipation after I take it. For days! So I only use them when I absolutly have to, but when I do take it, it works!
